rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Tony is the man. He definitely knows his stuff, and he is pretty enjoyable to listen to. He is also really funny, so that helps. The class is difficult, but not impossible. He clearly states what is expected of you, and he also has very clear expectations of tests.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Great professor!

Professor Castillo is engaging and you can tell he is really interested in the subject matter. He listened carefully to feedback after each exam, incorporating the feedback into how he ran the class (almost personalizing it). His lectures are long and not very interesting, but you don't necessarily have to go to class to pass. Overall great guy.

Karl is very competent. He is extremely clear, creates all the notes you will need in powerpoints, and gives you study guides. I found this class *very* easy. That being said, averages on the tests were around a 2.5-2.6 gpa (?), even after he bumps them up by 6-10%. If you're competent, you should do really well. It is an interesting course.

The best professor I have had. I took his Marine Science class first semester of my freshmen year and he made the class so amazing I declared a minor and hope to take all classes with him! He is the most caring and understanding professor there is. He always makes sure you are on the right track and tries to get to know you. Awesome professor

MASC101 and GEOL103 are the same course - Karl is not just an awesome professor, he's an awesome person. exams are easy if you follow the notes. he gives a comprehensive study guide before each exam. really understanding and willing to help anyone!
Great Professor.  Very Enthusiastic!!!
Great Professor.  Very Enthusiastic.

He is from Belize and is difficult to understand. He also didn't wear a mic in a large lecture hall, very hard to hear! When going through power points he doesn't give you time to write down all the notes!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I took a FYS with Dr. Martens and was blown away by his experience and enthusiasm for the subject.  One of his main goals for the class was to get us involved in research.  The class involved reading  articles and writing short one-page summaries of them.  They were pretty easy as long as some effort was put into them.  I fully recommend his class.

A very knowledgable man who sometimes commented on scientific topics without complete explanation. Weekly article readings and one page, double spaced EASY write-ups directly from the article are assigned. However, his grading system is a bit unclear because I turned in all assignments and participated in class discussions but got a B+

I took Dr. Martens in the freshman seminar program.  The class was an excellent learning experience.  Laid back atmosphere and small class size also allowed me to meet a lot of people.  Dr. Martens is definitely one of the best teachers at UNC.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Awesome guy, very accomadating. Tests were not too bad if you studied enough although many people didn't do too well, he does curve. Math lab is a **** but you learn. Required weekend fieldtrip.
The lectures are kind of boring, but the tests aren't too bad, pretty much memorizing the notes.  Nice guy.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Teske is a genius, and his research extravaganzas are awesome! His tests leave something to be desired. All he cares about is research (he left twice to go to another country to study oceanic stuff). The average for tests 2 and 3 of 4 were in the low 40's and so he had to curve it wayy up. Just take this class with somebody else or don't take.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Took his oceanography class as part of 3 seas. Dr. Reis is one of the best professors at Northeastern.  He explains things clearly and is fair in his grading.  He lectures fast but he's smart and I learned alot from the class.  Definately one of the brightest teachers I have had.
Very approachable, explains things well, easy on the eyes. You must do the readings but they're almost always interesting. TAKE HIM!!!
Too bad the class was in the afternoon--hard to stay awake in the chemistry topics but got much better as the class went on. Liked the pictures from Justin's field sites.
gREAT COURSE.  Thanks Dr. R!!!
this curse had a LOT of chemistry and could use more biology, but otherwise good
interesting but lectures are a bit long especially after lunch
i got a lot out of this class-best class at UNC
excellent and fun class. take it if you like the ocean
Good course.  I liked Dr. Rieses teaching style and the guest speakers, as well.  A lot of reading but not too many assignmnets.
i really liked Ries teaching style though he goes too fast some times, and i am not a scientist.  but glad i took the class. learned alot
Nice beard.
Pretty good class.  2 much chemistry for me
Dr. Ries is enthusiastic about the subject, but sometimes he goes to fast.  This is a good course but be prepared to get a lot of information.  Exams are fair and there is curve.
was a required class.  worth it though. lectures were well prepared and there were 2 fun field trips - one to the coast and one to the mountains.  exams are tough but grading is fair.
take this course - you will learn a lot about the ocean. too much reading, but easier to digest the lectures if you keep up with it.
awesome course!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
this course was a detailed intro course into the marine world.  too  much chem and not enough dolphins, but a good course nonetheless.  Ries is fair and does all he can to help.
great class, great teach

Prof. Ries was great.  I didn't really buckle down till maybe October and still came out with a good grade.  The exams are very straightforward:  go to lecture and read your book to do well.  His powerpoints are informative, he knows a lot about his subject.  Kind of quiet at first and then warms up to the class.  Great overall.

Very knowledgeable and nice guy. easy course. you don't need the book, just go to his lectures, and with average IQ (which I have) you'll do just fine. He tells you exactly what you are expected to know. No extra work for his class, and good use of media. Take him, even as an elective. It'll boost your GPA if you know the very basic material needed

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Bruno is awesome! Super chill guy, great professor, and his class isn't very hard. Do the basics and you'll be fine.
Loved him

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: At the beginning of the semester I was going to minor in Marine Science, but this class made me hate the subject. He's pretty disorganized, the final was today and we didn't get the study guide until yesterday. The tests aren't always on what's on the study guide. His voice is pretty boring and he is very awkward to be around. I don't recommend it.

I am a biology major but have gone back to take this 100 level course and have really enjoyed Professor White. His voice IS a little monotone, but as a science major I am used to that and the subject matter makes ALL the difference. The subject is fascinating. Most of all, I enjoy his lectures. He has great diagrams!!!
Not very enthusiastic. He seems to know a lot about the subject, but he just comes of as boring.
Terrrrrible. Waste of time. This guy is smart but he is BORING. Nervous, awkward, not engaging. Try something else.
BORING. Didnt go to class. Just look over the study guides and you'll know everything for the exams. Final is copied and pasted from midterms.

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME! Very boring instructor with a horrible use of powerpoint presentations.  His voice is annoying, he is jittery, and he does not engage students at all! The textbook is a waste of $$$ too.
VERY BORING! He has an annoying voice, jumbled powerpoints that repeat one another, and is not entertaining or interesting at all. The book is useless too. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: If you dislike math and physics, ENEC 222 is probably not for you. Exams heavily focus on problem solving but lectures focus on concepts. Math on  exams were problems never seen before or asked to solve. Homework/problem sets focus on computer science rather than math. I don't recommend this class although he is a nice guy and willing to help.
his problem sets are so long, lecture is pretty meaningless, and 60% of his exams are problems he purposefully chooses that no one has seen before. SAVE YOURSELF and take a professor that can teach!
Marc is clearly an intelligent man, but a terrible teacher.  Do not subject yourself to any of his courses.  His lectures are boring, rambling and disorganized.

Lecture could often be extremely boring, but he has a whimsical sense of humor and he is very passionate about the topic.  Take this class and you'll learn a lot, it will be so engrained into your brain however that you will not be able to forget it.

Do not take this class if you are not good at science even though it is supposed to be for non-science majors.  It is not an easy class at all.  He is very helpful during his office hours.   Lecture is pretty boring.
